qas.question: When did GE announce it was in talks to acquire the French engineering group Alstom?
What was the final acquisition price paid by GE for Alstom?
How big was the stake in Alstom taken by the French government as part of the acquisition deal?
When was GE's acquisition of Alstom agreed to by Alstom's board?
From which company did the Alstom board reject a rival acquisition proposal?
In what year was Alstom established?
How much was GE worth as of April 2014?
How much was Siemens and Mitsubishi Heave Industries worth as of June 2014?
How much was was Siemens-Mitsubishi Heavy Industries rival offer?
In what year was steam turbines invented?

context: In <a0_0>April <b5_0><b9_0>2014<b9_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, it was announced that GE was in talks to acquire the global power division of French engineering group Alstom for a figure of around <b6_0>$13 billion<b6_0/>. A rival joint bid was submitted in June 2014 by Siemens and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (MHI) with Siemens seeking to acquire Alstom's gas turbine business for <b7_0>€3.9 billion<b7_0/>, and MHI proposing a joint venture in steam turbines, plus a €3.1 billion cash investment. In <a3_0>June 2014<a3_0/> a formal offer From GE worth <a1_0><b8_0>$17 billion<b8_0/><a1_0/> was agreed by the Alstom board. Part of the transaction involved the French government taking a <a2_0>20%<a2_0/> stake in Alstom to help secure France's energy and transport interests, and French jobs. A rival offer from <a4_0>Siemens-Mitsubishi Heavy Industries<a4_0/> was rejected. The acquisition was expected to be completed in 2015.
